business.headline: Finance Buddha IPO: Anchor book oversubscribed before issue opening on November 6The IPO consists entirely of a fresh issue of 50.48 lakh shares in the price band of Rs 140 to Rs 142 per share. The issue opens for subscription on November 6 and closes on November 10.

Paytm delivers Rs 211 crore profit in Q2FY26, driven by AI-Led efficiency and cost disciplineOperating revenue grew 24% year-on-year to Rs 2,061 crore, led by growth in subscription merchants, higher Gross Merchandise Value (GMV), and continued expansion in financial services.

Unconditional cash transfers to women increasing fiscal pressure on states: ReportThe report notes that the number of states implementing UCT schemes for women has increased sharply from just two in 2022–23 to twelve in 2025–26.

Nvidia joins India Deep Tech Alliance as group secures $850 million boostThe alliance, launched in September 2025 with an initial commitment of $1 billion, aims to close the funding gap faced by research-driven startups in India.

China suspends 24% tariff on US goods for a year, keeps 10% levyThe announcement comes shortly after last week's meeting between Chinese President Xi Jinping and US President Donald Trump, which marked a step towards easing trade tensions between the world's two largest economies.

Tougher renewable norms may cloud India's clean energy growth: ReportThe proposed regulations, introduced by the Central Electricity Regulatory Commission (CERC) in September 2025, aim to make renewable power suppliers more accountable for maintaining grid discipline.

Guru Nanak Jayanti holiday: Is stock market open or closed for trading today?Apart from the scheduled holidays, the stock market also remains closed on all Saturdays and Sundays as part of the regular weekend schedule.

Nobody bigger than institution: Mehli Mistry in parting note to Tata Trust trusteesIn a letter addressed to all trustees, including Chairman Noel Tata, Mistry wrote that his loyalty to Ratan N Tata's vision comes with a duty to keep the Tata Trusts free from controversy. He noted that any escalation of internal matters could cause lasting damage to the organisation's reputation.

Reliance Group clarifies: ED-attached assets belong to Rcom, business unaffectedReliance Group said that the action has no impact on the business operations of Reliance Infrastructure and Reliance Power.

Is India's tax system fueling the IPO rush? Zerodha's Nithin Kamath thinks soIndia's booming startup economy may be running on a system that rewards valuation over value, and growth over resilience, says Nithin Kamath.

Hinduja Group Chairman Gopichand P Hinduja dies at London hospitalGopichand P Hinduja, who represented the second generation of the influential business family, took charge of the multinational Hinduja Group in May 2023, following the death of his elder brother, Srichand P Hinduja.
Sensex ends 519 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Eternal down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 519.34 points to close at 83,459.15, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 165.70 points to end at 25,597.65.

Bajaj Finance festive loan volume rises 27% as more first-time borrowers opt for creditThe company added 23 lakh new customers during this period, with 52% of them new to credit. This signals that access to formal borrowing is widening beyond traditional urban consumers.

Caveat filed, battle begins: What's next for Mehli Mistry and Tata TrustsMistry's three-year term as trustee ended on October 28, 2025. A circular was issued on 23 October seeking approval for his reappointment as a life trustee.

Is your money in good shape? 5 financial vitals to check every yearWhen was the last time you checked the health of your finances? Are your savings, investments, and expenses aligned with your goals, or drifting off track? A quick yearly check-up can reveal the answers.

UP government announces 1% recovery relief for rice millers and farmers. Details hereNearly two lakh employment opportunities are expected to get a boost as rice mills expand their operations. It will also increase competition among millers, making procurement faster and more efficient.

Race for the rare earths: Why India is tripling its magnet betIndia's clean-tech future depends on independence in the smallest technologies. Owning magnet manufacturing protects growth, shields jobs, and ensures ambitions are never paused by politics outside the country's borders.

From 20 years to 11: Expert shares how smart home loan hacks can save Rs 30 lakhTurning a 20-year home loan into an 11-year success story may sound ambitious, but with the right strategy, it's entirely possible. A few simple tweaks, like extra EMIs and gradual step-ups, can help borrowers save up to Rs 30 lakh in interest, says an expert.

Is Europe on your bucket list? Here's why now is the best time to visitAccording to the report, the average travel packages across major European destinations are 25–40% cheaper in the winter months compared to the busy June–August period.

EPFO partners with IPPB to offer doorstep Digital Life Certificate serviceThe Doorstep Digital Life Certificate service is based on Jeevan Pramaan, a digital certificate that confirms a pensioner's life status using Aadhaar-based biometric verification.

entertainment.headline: Mira Nair beams with pride as son Zohran Mamdani becomes New York's youngest mayor Zohran Mamdani made history by becoming the youngest and first Muslim mayor of New York City, defeating Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa. His win is being celebrated by family and supporters, especially his mother, filmmaker Mira Nair.

Telugu industry values work-life balance: Sonakshi Sinha after Jatadhara shoot Sonakshi Sinha discussed her experience working in the Telugu film industry, emphasising its structured work environment and improved work-life balance compared to Hindi cinema, as she prepares for the release of her debut Telugu film 'Jatadhara'.

Veteran director Suresh Krissna announces new film Anantha, releases poster Director Suresh Krissna has unveiled his latest project, 'Anantha', a biographical film centered on the life of the spiritual leader Sri Sathya Sai Baba. The announcement revealed details about the cast, crew, and production, marking Krissna's return to feature filmmaking.

Ishaan Khatter says Homebound not a failure despite cold box office response Director Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' received acclaim at international festivals but saw a cold box office response. Ishaan Khatter remains hopeful about the film's long-term impact and urges audiences to support niche cinema.

Yellow meets Game of Thrones: Chris reportedly finds love in Sophie Turner According to international media outlets, Chris Martin and Sophie Turner have started seeing each other after both ended previous relationships, with shared interests and a longstanding friendly connection underpinning their new romance.

Salman Khan faces consumer court action over alleged misleading pan masala ad A complaint in Kota Consumer Court against Bollywood actor Salman Khan highlighted concerns over claims made in pan masala advertisements, questioning their truthfulness and influence on young people.

Tom Hiddleston, Olivia Colman return in The Night Manager 2. See first look pics Tom Hiddleston returns as Jonathan Pine in 'The Night Manager Season 2' premiering on Prime Video and BBC. Eight years after its Emmy-winning debut, the popular spy thriller expands beyond John le Carr's novel with a new global story.

Border 2: Varun Dhawan embodies patriotic spirit in powerful first look The first look poster of Varun Dhawan from 'Border 2' is out. The actor will be seen playing Param Veer Chakra Hoshiyar Singh Dahiya.

Why Ranbir Kapoor, not Ranveer Singh, was chosen for Anurag Kashyap's Bombay Velvet Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap recently discussed the initial lack of confidence in Ranveer Singh from major directors, when he considered the actor for 'Bombay Velvet'. Kashyap spoke of pressures within the industry and his own journey while making critical decisions.

Lucky Ali exclusive: You can become famous, staying relevant is a responsibility In an age where algorithms often overpower artistry, Lucky Ali remains a symbol of authenticity. The singer talks about staying relevant without chasing trends, the honesty that anchors his music, and his views on AI.

Shiva 4K trailer launched: Nagarjuna, RGV celebrate film's legacy with anecdotes The trailer for the remastered 'Shiva' 4K Dolby Atmos was unveiled in Hyderabad, marking 36 years since the film's original release. The launch event saw Nagarjuna Akkineni and director Ram Gopal Varma sharing personal reflections on the film's impact.

All's Fair review: Where law meets lip gloss and logic takes a backseatRelease Date:Tue Nov 04, 2025 Ryan Murphy's 'All's Fair' tries to mix courtroom drama with celebrity glamour but ends up all sparkle, no soul. Starring Kim Kardashian in her first lawyer role, the show looks stunning on Hulu/JioHotstar, but beneath the gloss it's more showpiece than story.

Priyanka lands in Hyderabad as SSMB29 buzz grows, Rajamouli teases big reveal Priyanka Chopra was spotted in Hyderabad as excitement builds for her film with Mahesh Babu and SS Rajamouli. Social media exchanges among the film's stars have increased anticipation, with fans awaiting official details about their upcoming project.

Mammootty scripts history with 7th State Award, dedicates to fans of Bramayugam Veteran actor Mammootty achieves a record seventh Best Actor award at the 2024 Kerala State Film Awards and dedicates his victory to the audience of Bramayugam.

Haq review: Yami-Emraan's film a mature take on faith, law and legacy of Shah BanoRelease Date:Fri Nov 07, 2025 Haq movie review: 'Haq' is a powerful film inspired by the Shah Bano case, exploring faith and law. It highlights the struggle for women's dignity amidst societal and religious challenges.

BTS' Jimin, Jungkook reunite for Are You Sure?! season 2. Check release date here BTS' Jimin and Jungkook will be back with season 2 of 'Are You Sure?!', the hit travel reality show. The series is set to stream on JioHotstar in India in December.

Beyond our control: Madhuri Dixit's Toronto show organisers react to delay row Event organisers in Toronto have responded to criticism following Bollywood actor Madhuri Dixit's delayed appearance at a recent show, addressing concerns of mismanagement and outlining the sequence of events that led to the controversy.

Mastiii 4 trailer slammed for vulgarity, director Milap Zaveri responds Social media users reacted strongly to 'Mastiii 4', citing concerns about vulgarity. Director Milap Zaveri defended the movie and its portrayal of women.

Robert Pattinson says Dune 3 shoot was so hot people passed out from heatstroke Robert Pattinson revealed that the desert heat during 'Dune: Part Three' was so extreme he could barely function, calling the shoot one of the toughest he's ever faced. Despite the harsh conditions, director Denis Villeneuve's commitment to realism remains strong as the sci-fi epic gears up for its December 2026 release.

general news.headline: 'Vote chori' in Haryana? Rahul Gandhi claims Brazil model's photo used 22 timesA Brazilian model's photograph allegedly appearing 22 times on the Haryana poll rolls became the centerpiece of Rahul Gandhi's explosive voter fraud charge against the BJP and the Election Commission.

Zohran Mamdani's 'four words for Trump' in electric victory speechZohran Mamdani, who once described himself as Trump's 'worst nightmare', reminded the US President that the city that 'gave rise to him' could also defeat him.

26/11: Did Pak president's nuclear no-first-use offer trigger ISI to attack India?Former adviser of Pakistan president Asif Ali Zardari says the Mumbai 26/11 attacks were a response to his offer of a 'no first use' (of nuclear weapons) to India. But the chronology of facts suggests the attacks would have happened regardless of what he said.

Zohran Mamdani's election a silent revolt of Gen ZZohran Mamdani's historic election as New York City's mayor marks a generational turning point, revealing Gen Z's quiet yet determined rebellion against divisive politics through inclusion, collective action, and community-focused governance.

Haq review: Yami-Emraan's film a mature take on faith, law and legacy of Shah BanoRelease Date:Fri Nov 07, 2025Haq movie review: 'Haq' is a powerful film inspired by the Shah Bano case, exploring faith and law. It highlights the struggle for women's dignity amidst societal and religious challenges.

Live: 1 in every 8 Haryana voters fake, says Rahul Gandhi in big 'vote chori' chargeRahul Gandhi PC Live Updates: As Bihar gears up to vote for the first phase of assembly elections scheduled for tomorrow, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is addressing yet another press conference today. The opposition leader is claiming  more evidence of vote chori in his press conference titled 'The H Files'. This is his third presser related to the matter. Stay tuned with indiatoday.in for latest updates.

Watch: Proud women neighbours raise bats, welcome coach Amol MuzumdarIndia's World Cup-winning women's team coach Amol Muzumdar received an emotional homecoming in Vile Parle, where women from his neighbourhood lined up with raised bats to form a guard of honour as he returned after guiding India to their first ODI World Cup title.

Step out from old to new: NYC mayor-elect Mamdani quotes Nehru in victory speechIn his victory address, Zohran Mamdani quoted from Jawaharlal Nehru's iconic 'Tryst with Destiny' speech, which underscored his campaign theme of transformation and renewal.

David Beckham is now Sir David Beckham: Football great knighted by King CharlesDavid Beckham has been formally knighted for his services to football and British society. The former England captain received the honour from King Charles III during a ceremony held at Windsor Castle in Berkshire on Tuesday.

Vreels: A Game-Changing Platform Pushing Social Media Beyond TikTok and InstagramVreels isn't just about sharing, it's about connecting meaningfully. Through built-in chat, voice, and video call features, users can communicate without leaving the app.

4 killed after being hit by train while crossing railway track in UP's MirzapurAccording to railway officials, the victims had alighted from the Chopan-Prayagraj Express on the side opposite the platform at the Chunar junction in Mirzapur. As they attempted to cross the tracks, they were struck by another train, the Howrah-Kalka Netaji Express, coming from the opposite direction.

Ulfat-e-Sitam: Handshakes and hidden knives in the Modi–Trump friendshipTrump's mix of tareefs and threats towards PM has, for now, given Rahul Gandhi constant fodder. In a Bihar election campaign lacking narrative and consistency, the Congress is trying to loosely cling to Trump - whether it's his outrageous claims of stopping an India–Pakistan war or his "dead economy" jibe.

Mumbai CEO turns to LinkedIn for love with viral 'Open To Marry' postA Mumbai CEO's post on LinkedIn suggesting using the #OpenToMarry tag to find love went viral, turning the professional networking site into a platform for matchmaking.

The Zohran blueprint: How one New Yorker rewrote the rules of politicsWhat made Mamdani's campaign different was tone. He spoke with a moral clarity that cut through cynicism. He treated voters not as metrics, but as participants in a story about what New York could be. That story resonated most with younger voters, immigrants, and working-class New Yorkers.

Maruti Suzuki creates history, crosses 3 crore domestic sales in IndiaMaruti Suzuki India Limited has created history by becoming the first carmaker in India to achieve 3 crore cumulative domestic sales, marking a major milestone in its 42-year journey.

Sent back just because we are Hindus: Pak turns away 12 pilgrims from Sikh JathaPakistani authorities denied entry to 12 Hindu pilgrims travelling with a Sikh Jatha for Guru Nanak Dev Ji's birth anniversary, sparking controversy. The incident raises concerns over religious freedom and bilateral commitments between India and Pakistan.

Harmanpreet Kaur gets World Cup tattoo: Now, I will see you every morningHarmanpreet Kaur immortalises India's Women's World Cup triumph with a tattoo. The victory ends a decades-long wait and highlights the team's perseverance and leadership.

A Bollywood touch in Zohran Mamdani's victory speech ft Dhoom MachaleZohran Mamdani has etched his place in history as New York City's first Muslim mayor, the first of South Asian heritage and the first to be born in Africa. He will also become the city's youngest mayor in more than a century when he takes office on January 1, 2026.

Typhoon Kalmaegi kills 66 in Philippines; 26 missing as flood traps manyTyphoon Kalmaegi has claimed at least 66 lives and left 26 people missing in the central Philippines, with many casualties resulting from widespread flooding that stranded residents on rooftops and swept away numerous vehicles in a province still recovering from a deadly earthquake, news agency AP reported.

British vlogger visits Kerala, calls out 'disgusting' littering in Varkala videoIn a video posted on Instagram, Alex Wanders is seen walking along the cliff edge in Varkala, describing the beauty of the spot and the garbage strewn across it.

Having a boyfriend is not embarrassing, but your delulu could beThe growing comfort with being a single woman in India didn't happen overnight. But this singlehood revolution isn't a rejection of love either.

Trump's Nasa chief nominee faces budget cuts, layoffs, and a shutdownThe American space agency is in the middle of one of its biggest budget reduction phases at the behest of the Donald Trump White House.

Delhi's air quality improves slightly, still 'poor' as haze lingersDelhi's air quality improved slightly to poor from very poor on Wednesday despite lingering haze. Reduced stubble burning and environmental fines have helped, but pollution remains a serious challenge in NCR.

Trump not on ballot: US President on Republicans' poor show in local pollsDonald Trump's post on Truth Social came shortly after Democrats swept a trio of races on Tuesday in the first major elections since he assumed office in January, giving the party a shot of momentum as it looks ahead to the congressional midterm elections next year.

Bharti Singh gets emotional while watching Shehnaaz Gill's Ikk Kudi. VideoComedian Bharti Singh was seen getting emotional while watching Shehnaaz Gill's Punjabi film 'Ikk Kudi', and the video quickly went viral online.

Mira Nair beams with pride as son Zohran Mamdani becomes New York's youngest mayorZohran Mamdani made history by becoming the youngest and first Muslim mayor of New York City, defeating Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa. His win is being celebrated by family and supporters, especially his mother, filmmaker Mira Nair.

sports.headline: World-class Arshdeep Singh understands why he gets dropped: India bowling coach India bowling coach Morne Morkel has backed left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh, calling him a world-class bowler who understands the team's decision to experiment with different combinations ahead of the T20 World Cup next year.

Harmanpreet Kaur gets World Cup tattoo: Now, I will see you every morning Harmanpreet Kaur immortalises India's Women's World Cup triumph with a tattoo. The victory ends a decades-long wait and highlights the team's perseverance and leadership.

Some compared it to 1983: Sunil Gavaskar on India's seismic Women's World Cup win India's long-awaited Women's World Cup crown has been hailed as one of the nation's greatest cricketing triumphs. Sunil Gavaskar says the victory will shake the world order in women's cricket, inspiring a new generation to dream bigger.

Bangladesh women's cricket team captain accused of beating juniors; board denies Out-of-favour Bangladesh pacer Jahanara Alam has levelled serious allegations against the national board and captain Nigar Sultana Joty, claiming that the current skipper "beats up" junior players in the team "a lot."

Once trolled as the worst, Mahaveer Raghunathan's comeback keeps F1 dream alive Once a figure of trolling and ridicule, Mahaveer Raghunathan has reinvented himself in the Italian GT Championship to keep his Formula One dreams alive. The Indian racer opens up on his journey, recovering from a disastrous F2 campaign and coming out on top.

ICC Cracks Down: Haris Rauf Banned, Suryakumar Fined After Heated India-Pak Asia Cup Clashes This special report focuses on the fallout from the fiery Asia Cup clashes between India and Pakistan, with the ICC announcing sanctions against several players for breaching the Code of Conduct. The bulletin highlights that Suryakumar Yadav was accused of making 'politically charged remarks' and snubbing handshakes with Pakistan players, leading to a fine. Pakistan's Haris Rauf has been handed a two-match ban for provocative gestures during the tournament. Additionally, India's Jasprit Bumrah accepted a demerit point for his reactive gesture after dismissing Rauf. The ICC also issued an official warning to Pakistan's Sahibzada Farhan for his controversial 'gun celebration' after scoring a half-century against India during a Super 4 match in Dubai. The sanctions were announced after hearings by the ICC's Elite Panel of Match Referees following incidents in the matches on September 14, 21 and 28.

David Beckham is now Sir David Beckham: Football great knighted by King Charles David Beckham has been formally knighted for his services to football and British society. The former England captain received the honour from King Charles III during a ceremony held at Windsor Castle in Berkshire on Tuesday.

Manchester United's situation is sad, Amorim cannot work wonders: Ronaldo Cristiano Ronaldo has delivered a brutal assessment of Manchester United's current state, saying manager Ruben Amorim cannot be expected to "work miracles" at Old Trafford and expressing sadness over the club's continued struggles.

Historic Win: India's Queens Arrive To Heroes' Welcome After World Cup Glory! This special report covers the triumphant return of the Indian women's cricket team to Delhi after securing their first-ever ICC Women's ODI World Cup title. After defeating South Africa in a landmark final, the Harmanpreet Kaur-led squad landed in the capital for a scheduled meeting with the Prime Minister. The team received a grand welcome at their hotel, marked by dhol beats, dance, and a special cake-cutting ceremony to celebrate the historic achievement. Players and support staff were greeted with enthusiasm by fans and hotel staff, celebrating the crowning moment for women's cricket in India before they meet the Prime Minister.

India's Women's World Cup win: What it means to a men's cricket fan India's title triumph at the Women's World Cup 2025 will go down as one of the greatest moments in the country's cricketing history. For someone who has grown up following the men's game, this victory feels different - it slowly breaks down the invisible barrier that once separated the two teams and draws me closer to the women who are now redefining what Indian cricket stands for.

Champions League: Liverpool beat Real Madrid, 10-man Bayern Munich humble PSGLiverpool secured a narrow 1-0 victory over Real Madrid at Anfield, while Bayern Munich, reduced to ten men, defeated Paris Saint-Germain 2-1 in the Champions League group stage.

Ten boys, one fearless cricketer: How Richa Ghosh was forged in Siliguri's netsRicha Ghosh's World Cup heroics trace their roots back to the dusty nets of Siliguri, where a lone girl trained among boys, forged her fearlessness through sheer grit, and rose to become India's ultimate finisher under pressure.

WPL 2026 Retention: Purse, price slab and all you need to knowThe retentions for the Women's Premier League (WPL) 2026 will take place on November 5, followed by the auction on November 27 in New Delhi. Mumbai Indians will enter the new season as the defending champions, having also lifted the title in 2023.

Ashes: Konstas dropped, Labuschagne recalled in Australia's squad for 1st TestYoung opener Sam Konstas has been left out of Australia's squad for the first Ashes Test against England in Perth, with Marnus Labuschagne earning a recall and uncapped left-hander Jake Weatherald handed a maiden call-up.

Shaheen Afridi era begins as Pakistan survive last-over thriller vs South AfricaFaisalabad witnessed a thrilling finish as Pakistan edged past South Africa by two wickets to take a 1-0 lead in the ODI series, marking a memorable return of international cricket to Iqbal Stadium after 17 years.

Deepti Sharma, Richa Ghosh to be felicitated by football giants East BengalEast Bengal Club will honour Deepti Sharma and Richa Ghosh for their outstanding contributions to India's first Women's World Cup victory, recognising their record-breaking performances and inspiring journeys from Bengal.

Always thought of myself as a world champion: Pratika Rawal after India's victoryWomen's World Cup 2025: Pratika Rawal scored 308 runs from seven matches in the tournament, including a century against New Zealand. Pratika was ruled out of the tournament after the match against Bangladesh due to an ankle and knee injury.

Shafali Verma handled pressure beautifully, immense respect for her: Pratika RawalIn an interview with India Today, Pratika Rawal praised Shafali Verma for her match-winning heroics in the 2025 Women's World Cup final, calling her comeback incredible after stepping in as an injury replacement.

Pratika was ruled out of the tournament after the match against Bangladesh due to an ankle and knee injury.

Shafali Verma handled pressure beautifully, immense respect for her: Pratika RawalIn an interview with India Today, Pratika Rawal praised Shafali Verma for her match-winning heroics in the 2025 Women's World Cup final, calling her comeback incredible after stepping in as an injury replacement.

Team India greeted with rousing reception in New Delhi after Women's World Cup winWomen's World Cup 2025: Harmanpreet Kaur's India landed in New Delhi on Tuesday and were greeted with a rousing reception. On November 2, India beat South Africa by 52 runs at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai to win the title for the first time.

Radha Yadav's father steals the show on social media, proudly lifts Women's World CupA photo of Radha Yadav's father lifting the Women's ODI World Cup trophy during India's on-field celebrations has gone viral. The moment captured the pride and joy shared by families behind the team's historic first world title.

Watch: Proud women neighbours raise bats, welcome coach Amol MuzumdarIndia's World Cup-winning women's team coach Amol Muzumdar received an emotional homecoming in Vile Parle, where women from his neighbourhood lined up with raised bats to form a guard of honour as he returned after guiding India to their first ODI World Cup title.

Jasprit Bumrah, Arshdeep Singh escape without suspension after Asia Cup rowJasprit Bumrah and Arshdeep Singh escaped suspension after ICC cleared them of major charges from the 2025 Asia Cup, with Bumrah receiving only a warning and one demerit point for his on-field gesture.

ICC suspends Pakistan's Haris Rauf, fines Suryakumar Yadav for Asia Cup rowThe ICC has come out with the verdict of their disciplinary hearings during the heated India vs Pakistan matches during the Asia Cup as Haris Rauf was handed a two-game ban, while Suryakumar was fined 30 percent of his match fees.

Amanjot Kaur quashes rumours of grandmother's death: My 90s kid doing absolutely fineIndia all-rounder Amanjot Kaur dismissed rumours about her grandmother's death, confirming that she is in good health and urging people not to spread misinformation. Amanjot, who played a key role in India's World Cup triumph, took a stunning catch to dismiss Laura Wolvaardt in the final against South Africa.

Sean Williams reveals battle with drug addiction, Zimbabwe career ends abruptlyZimbabwe cricket has announced that former captain Sean Williams is battling drug addiction and won't be considered for national team selection anymore. Williams' current contract won't be extended after its expiry on December 31 this year.

Please help me! Suryakumar Yadav makes plea to AB de Villiers to save ODI careerSuryakumar Yadav has asked AB de Villiers to help him revive his ODI career as the 35-year-old is eyeing a comeback into the side. Suryakumar is currently a T20I specialist for India and leads the side in the format.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
